fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32180].
  {panel}

We use Excel files as attachments on many Confluence pages. These files are quite often changed/saved, resulting in many versions of each file.

The feature to remove attachment versions is very helpful; but the problem is that you can only do it with space admin permissions.
(https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Deleting+an+Attachment)

There are two problems with this:
- We don't usually assign space admin permissions to the users editing these files. But the users should be able to manage their attachment versions themselves, as the space admin is the IT guy most of the times.
- There's also the permission "Delete Attachments" - why doesn't this permission also cover deleting the versions? It doesn't make sense not being able to remove a certain version while being able to delete the whole attachment (including ALL versions).

So my request is to include the attachment version removal right into the "Delete Attachment" right.

Thanks in advance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32167].
  {panel}

After previewing edits and going back to editing, you can't edit the entire document anymore.

1. Edit a Confluence page that is longer than one screenful.
2. Click the "Preview" button.
3. Click the "Edit" button.
4. Try scrolling to the end of the document, you can't because scrolling no longer works.

After step 4, you have no option but to click the "Save" button, or loose any changes made in step 1. This defeats the purpose of having a preview of edits.

This is with the OnDemand version of Confluence.

h4. Workarounds: 
* Resize the window
* Type a newline into the window
* Open the developer console.

Anything that changes the height of the editor will cause a recalculation of whether a scrollbar is required.
fields.summary: Cannot scroll editor after viewing edits

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32164].
  {panel}

h4. Problem summary
Under specific conditions, Confluence can run out of memory when a user goes to edit a Confluence page or view his drafts (Username > Drafts), following a sequence of events:
# User A goes edit a page (Version 1)
# Confluence auto-saves a draft based on Version 1, and user does not save the page
# User B edits the same page and saves, promoting the page to Version 2
# User A views his drafts (or edits the page again)
# Confluence tries to merge the three versions (Version 1, Version 1 draft, and Version 2), and results in Confluence hanging

Thread dump shows one or more threads looking like this and using 100% CPU:
{noformat}
"TP-Processor58" daemon prio=10 tid=0x5cd56800 nid=0x7f24 runnable [0x5c4ff000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:801)
	at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:828)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.calcQDistance(Measure.java:360)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.qDist(Measure.java:306)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.stringDist(Measure.java:187)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.childListDistance(Measure.java:205)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.getBestCandidate(HeuristicMatching.java:160)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:120)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.buildMatching(HeuristicMatching.java:74)
	at tdm.lib.TriMatching. (TriMatching.java:42)
	at tdm.lib.TriMatching. (TriMatching.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger.mergeContent(TDMMerger.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.diffs.PageLayoutAwareMerger.mergeContent(PageLayoutAwareMerger.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager.mergeContent(DefaultDraftManager.java:211)
{noformat}

h4. Workaround

*Warning:*
Workarounds involve deleting one or more drafts. Drafts contain edits that have not yet been saved, so important work can be lost by deleting them.

*5.5 and later*
If a user has been identified causing this problem, they can go to {{/users/viewmydrafts.action}} page and discard either all of their drafts or just the draft for the page that is known to trigger this problem.

*5.2 to 5.4*
Remove all drafts for the given user (Remember to replace {{<username>}} with the username of the user):
{code}
DELETE FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE contentid IN (SELECT contentid FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT' AND creator in (SELECT user_key FROM user_mapping where username = '<username>'));
DELETE FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT' AND creator in (SELECT user_key FROM user_mapping where username = '<username>');
{code}

*All versions*
Alternatively, all the drafts can be deleted directly from the DB:

# Back up Confluence DB as a precaution
# Run the following DELETE statements against the DB:
{code}
DELETE FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE contentid IN (SELECT contentid FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT');
DELETE FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT';
{code}
# Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics > Flush all (down at the bottom)
fields.summary: TDM Merger causes Confluence OOME due to infinite loop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32163].
  {panel}

A review of Confluence has been completed by experts at UC Berkley regarding accessibility to Confluence for the visually impaired.  Please see the attached word document which summarizes the findings of said report.  Included are the following recommendations but please see the document for more details.

* Text editor: since text editor is inherently broken and unusable by a screen reader user, the text editor should be completely overhauled and/or replaced with an accessible alternative.
* For dynamic content: ARIA (Accessible-Rich Internet Applications) alert to indicate to user that the content has been dynamically changed.
* For semantic structure (headings): all pages should be reviewed to ensure that no heading levels have been skipped. Specifically, on search results page, search results should be h2 instead of h3.
* All images should have appropriate alt tags. 
* Developer should use ARIA landmarks to help screen reader users identify main content and navigation regions on pages.
fields.summary: Improve usability of Confluence for the visually impaired

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32152].
  {panel}

Raised by a customer as a comment from the Page Properties Report Docs https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Report+Macro?focusedCommentId=434209459#comment-434209459
{quote}
Hi, I am trying to have 3 page properties macros in different sections on 1 page. They all have the same label. I would like to collect all data in 1 page properties report. If I understand the documentation well, this should work (as long as the labels are the same). However, it seems that only the last one or the one in the righthand section is included in the report. I have tried without mentioning the column headers and with mentioning them. In the latter case, no values are displayed for the columns that do not belong to the last page properties macro. In the first case, only the columns belonging to the last or the right-hand macro are included. Please, advise.
{quote}

Current functionality is that when there are multiple Page Properties macros (with the same label specified) on a page the Page Properties Report macro only reports the data contained in ONE Page Properties macro in the report.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a page with a page properties macro. In that macro, add a table that looks like this:
|| a | 1 |
|| b | 2 |
2. In that macro, give it a label 'prop1'
3. Add another page property macro on that page, give it the same label 'prop1' with the contents:
|| c | 3 |
|| d | 4 |
4. Save the page. Now create a new page in the space.
In that new page, create a page properties report macro and give it the label 'prop1'.
Outcome: It reports on ONE table only  (c and d)
This feature request is so that it displays all data (a, b, c and d) because the label 'prop1' is specified on both. 

This appears to be the reverse of the use case in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28776
fields.summary: It is not possible to have multiple page properties macros on the same page with the same label and report them on the same page properties report macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32143].
  {panel}

Hello,

Share links is currently used to share and collaborate on web content and create a centralised repository of useful links. 

However, there are some improvements that can be implemented in order to enhance the customer experience. The improvements are:
* Personalization option for a user to create a filter for such list of links that belong to that user, i.e. adding personal label to the filter.
* This filter should be able to be updated without losing the personal label attached to it.
* Extend the ability of link collection to be compiled not only limited for each space but throughout the whole site.

Main goal for this improvement is to provide a centralized list of links of customer's company wide resources that can be selected by each wiki user for their dashboard.

Thank you and regards,
Lazuardi

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32137].
  {panel}

Hello,

In Jira, there is an mbean available which is called com.atlassian.jira.
With this one, it is possible to receive information about the Basic Data Source for monitoring purposes.

For example the following values can be retrieved:
com.atlassian.jira:name=BasicDataSource/MaxIdle
com.atlassian.jira:name=BasicDataSource/MinIdle
com.atlassian.jira:name=BasicDataSource/MaxActive
com.atlassian.jira:name=BasicDataSource/NumIdle
com.atlassian.jira:name=BasicDataSource/NumActive

In Confluence this option is not available. Is it possible to implement this for Confluence, too?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32126].
  {panel}

Our users are increasingly avoiding Confluence as a knowledge base, since dropbox / skydrive offer much better usability in their work scenarios. Our people travel much and want to have their documents offline on their own devices with automatic sync á la dropbox.

We do not want to introduce owncloud.org or similar services as a parallel solution. Also 3rd party webdav sync clients do not offer the level of usability required by our users.

When can we expect something similar for Confluence?
I assume that syncing the page content and page meta content is a bigger issue. However, this is not really necessary in a first step. Already the syncing of attachments in a folder(page) and sub folder (sub pages) would be tremendously helpful.

It would be great, if this can find its way into the product roadmap - I assume that we are not the only one looking for alternatives.

Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32115].
  {panel}

Long time ago, I left a comment in 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/users/removepagenotification.action?pageId=251006017

Since I left a comment there, I get notifications because I'm added as a watcher by adding a comment automatically.

Whenever, I try to use the link of "Stop Watching Page" from email, 
it gave me "Page Not Found". 
I thought Atlassian had a problem with broken link.

Today, I figured out "True meaning" of this "Page Not Found".
As you can see in attached screen capture here, 
it noticed that there is a possibility that the page exists but I don't have permission to view it.

Then I realized that I won't be able to stop watching without logging it.

So, what I am trying to suggest here is...
1. If the Page exists, don't display it as Page Not Found, especially when user has not logged in.
2. Or, at least, when accessing"removepagenotification.action" page without logged in session, it should redirect to Login page. Because no one will be able to manage without logging in.
3. Simply, redirect to login page where user credential is mandatory.
4. Or, you could redirect to login page if you see "src=email" parameter in URL, which means the user is registered user of the system because the user received an email regarding this page.

Atlassian people keep their login always, so you might not see this often.
However, as a external customer, we don't keep login for CAC.
"Page Not Found" message was improper in this case.

Please, improve this behavior.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Improve Not logged in status when accessing remove page notification page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32108].
  {panel}

Currently, Administrators can receive notification via email only when a user signs up to Confluence. This user will be created in Confluence Internal Directory.
However, if Confluence is using Delegated External Directory while enabling 'Copy User on Login' option, when an LDAP user logs in to the system, Administrators doesn't get any email notification.

It would be very helpful if Confluence Administrators is notified via email with the same information as when a user signs up to Confluence such as the following:
{panel}
|    A new user joined Confluence: 
|
|    Username:Name
|    Email: name.lastname@...
|    Your Confluence site now has N users, with a license limit of 2,000. 
{panel}

This would be a great improvement for Confluence Administrators to track the number of licensed user in the system and know the latest user creation to the system.

There is two powerpoint file attach in this ticket.
* [4allvisible.pptx|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/106524/4allvisible.pptx] - no hidden text
* [5hiddentxtbox.pptx|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/106525/5hiddentxtbox.pptx] - hidden text in the blue box

All the content from both of the  file will be viewable in the Confluence page once they are attached and displayed in the view macro.
fields.summary: Confluence powerpoint view macro should not show hidden text in of powerpoint attachment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32075].
  {panel}

As a user,
I want alphabet markers for bullet lists,
So that I can identify list items, but not necessarily impose order.

AC:
- A. In Editor menu bar, next to the numbered bullet list, there should be another button for alphabet bullet list.
- B. Assign hotkey, e.g., Ctrl+Shift+A ('A' for alphabet).
- C. Assign a macro char (just like '*' is used for normal list, and '#' used for numbered list).
- D. The alphabet list operates just like the numbered list, except shows uppercase alphabet chars (or provide option to choose capitalization, for the whole list).  Once the list passes 'Z', start with 'AA', 'AB', etc.
fields.summary: Editor - Provide alphabet bullet list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32066].
  {panel}

Confluence doesn't save user action on its page tree and open only the tree where the page reside once it accessed. 

*How to replicate :*

# Access a space with a documentation theme
# Open multiple page trees on the side bar
# Access one of the page
# Confluence will close the other opened page tree and will *only* open the tree where the accessed page reside

Sometime, user might open multple page to help them navigate through Confluence space multiple pages easily. However, due to this behavior such user may need to open those trees multiple times.
fields.summary: Confluence should Save User Action On its Page Tree
Provide Old Dropdown Menu for Attachment Macros
Page did not save and is not recoverable in Confluence
Link the table issues are created from to the epic they are linked to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32057].
  {panel}

Please add an option to upload an audio file into the user profile with the (preferred/correct) spelling of the user name. Please add a "play" button to spell out the name.

Rational:
When working with multi-national, multi-language teams, there are many cases where the user name can not be described for the whole team to use.

In many cases, the English spelling is not enough to know how to spell the user name.

Entering the name in local language is not useful. e.g., Non Chinese speakers can not use the Chinese symbols to know how to pronounce the name.

Extra bonus: It will be nice if there will  be a dictionary of spelled names that will arrive pre-bundled, and allow the users to choose from those names (best on their first name).
fields.summary: Allow loading of audio file - name pronounciation in user profile
reStructuredText support. Is it possible?

Hi,

I need to monitor macro execution time in order to improve Confluence performance. I've found [the following|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Identifying+Slow+Performing+Macros] article in Atlassian Docs.
This method works fine for some Confluence macros but it doesn't show any results for \{jira\} macro of "JIRA Macros" plugin.
How can I take the same log records for the macros of this plugin?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32038].
  {panel}

When attempting to update the docs for space colour scheme I noticed a number of items don't seem to be in use anymore (not that I could tell in the space with either the default theme or doc theme):

* Page menu selected background 
* Space name text
* Border and dividers
* Tab navigation background
* Tab navigation text
* Tab navigation background highlight
* Tab navigation text highlight
 
Could we remove these, or if they are still in use (but only in specific circumstances) separate them out from the basic header colour scheme options?  Its very confusing.
fields.summary: Update colour scheme UI to remove redundant items

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32036].
  {panel}

h2. Problem
* Our Tools menu is overloaded with a lot of things, a lot of people have banner blindness to things there
* Sharing is more than sending an email, it's about things like sharing a link to the page or even one day sharing a private URL to a page

h2. Suggestion
# Kill the Tools > Link to this page dialog
# Update the Share button to include a section "Copy link to page..."
When you click on that, it would "accordion up" effect and give you a text box to copy the tiny URL link for the page

Sample mockup:
!http://cl.ly/image/412k1K353x1O/Image%202013.12.19%2010%3A59%3A38%20am.png!
fields.summary: Remove Tools > "Link to this page" feature, move that functionality to the "Share Page" dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32033].
  {panel}

Currently, an applcation link can only have one instance to each server it link to.

However, when importing spaces from external Confluence instance pointing to external Jira instance that are also imported, all the application links will point to the old instance, breaking every macro using that link.

The fix suggested mention editing and saving the affected macro, but when you have hundred of macro, this is not a viable option.

The alternative is to go into the database and rename every occurrence of the old link and replace ti with the new name.

By allowing Application Links aliases, one could create an alias using the old link name and all macro would still work.


This also apply to Jira macho, which utilize the Application Link name to references which Jira instance to use. Should the application link be renamed or imported with a different name, they will all break.

Editing the macro will fix it, but in the case of a voluminous space, this can be impossible unless manually converted inside the database while Confluence is offline.
fields.summary: Application link Alias

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32032].
  {panel}

Lacking ways to filter the restricted pages you can view from space admin in Confluence (the list includes docs in the trash for example), it would be nice / make more sense if 

- The restricted pages list included pages in the trash. If you click such pages, you get a page stating it's in the trash, but then you can't remove the restriction. I would do so just so I could get it off my report. We use restrictions to hide pages before release.
- You could filter the list (e.g. don't include pages in trash, or person, or type of restriction)
- You could sort the list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31993].
  {panel}

Since the latest OnDemand release, pulling a filter from JIRA in Confluence isn't working as expected. When used, the following message is returned:
{quote}
There are problems with the current configuration for this gadget. The errors below may have been caused by the deletion of entities required by the gadget or by changes to your permissions.
* *Invalid project or filter*
{quote}

This can also manifest as the following error message:
{quote}The filter for this gadget did not return any issues{quote}
Even though the filter in question does return issues.

This also prevents the creation of any gadget that uses JIRA filters, aside from the JIRA Issues macro (which uses a different communication mechanism not affected by this problem).

Screenshots are attached.

h3. Download customers also affected

Confluence 5.3.4, 5.4 and greater are also affected by this issue, when using Trusted Apps for applinks between Confluence and JIRA.

h3. Workarounds

The known workarounds for this issue are:
* manually replace the gadget filter with a [JIRA Issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro]. When configuring the JIRA Issues macro (just called 'JIRA' in the macro browser), you can have it use a filter by entering {{filter=FILTERID}} into the search box.
* [Reconfigure the applink authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Configuring+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link] between affected applications to use OAuth instead of Trusted Apps.
* For Confluence behind firewall v5.4, 5.4.1 (*Do not install on different versions of confluence*), install the open social plugin from [Steve's comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31993?focusedCommentId=549703&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-549703]. Flush all caches if you have any issue to access the gadgets after the plugin installation.
fields.summary: Filter results gadget (or anything that uses a filter in JIRA) isn't working.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31992].
  {panel}

When a user try to upgrade Confluence using installer version, Confluence will remove directories in the installation directories and create a new set of directories.

However, directories such as {{temp}}, {{logs}} and {{work}} are not touched during the upgrade process. This mean those three directories might have a different permission configuration.

This leads to Confluence have the possibility for not being able to access those directories which cause issues.

It would be great if we could warn our customer by putting the above information on our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence].
fields.summary: Upgrading Confluence Using Installer Version Leads to Permission Issue

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31976].

With upgrade to new Confluence 5.3.1, in IE (v10, v11) when I view a page in Hierarchy view, and then drag-and-drop a page to move it to a new location, the graphics hang upon the drop (and appear graphically merged), and the action appears to be a no-op.  Chrome appears to be fine.

Workaround is to use "Move" command directly, but that is tedious for multiple moves.

Thank you,
Johnny
